title: Jungle 1
voiceover: Did you know that the Amazon rainforest releases 20% of the world's oxygen? It's truly the planet's green lung.

title: Jungle 2
voiceover: The jungle is home to half of the world's species, many still undiscovered. Every step can reveal a new mystery.

title: Jungle 3
voiceover: Jungles have layers like a cake. From the emergent layer to the forest floor, each layer is a world of its own.

title: Jungle 4
voiceover: Bioluminescent fungi in jungles create a natural light show, glowing eerily in the dark, humid nights.

title: Jungle 5
voiceover: The Amazon has a river so hot it boils. Locals call it the 'Kettle River,' where temperatures reach 200°F.

title: Jungle 6
voiceover: Jungles are not only in warm climates. Cloud forests are high-altitude jungles, misty and full of mosses.

title: Jungle 7
voiceover: The Congo Basin's peatlands store more carbon than any other jungle terrain, a critical climate change buffer.

title: Jungle 8
voiceover: A jungle soil fungus is the source of a powerful antibiotic, highlighting the untapped medicinal potential.

title: Jungle 9
voiceover: Flying dragons exist in jungles! Draco lizards glide between trees, a dazzling display of evolution.

title: Jungle 10
voiceover: Jungle elephants create pathways used by other animals, playing a vital role in the ecosystem's health.

title: Jungle 11
